section.title: Library sites
section.para: Orc programs are provided a variety of sites in the Orc standard library. These sites are declared in the Orc prelude, which is implicitly included in Orc programs. The standard prelude declarations are documented in the Standard Library chapter.
(Note that the Orc prelude also declares functions and types, not only sites.)

Orc programs are expected to rely on the host language and environment for all but the most essential sites. For example, in the Java implementation of Orc, the entire Java standard library is available to Orc programs via class declarations. Therefore, the Orc standard library aims only to provide convenience for the most common Orc idioms, not the complete set of features needed for general-purpose programming.

example.title: Using a standard library site
example.programlisting: --The Floor site, also called the greatest integer function or integer value Floor(2.5)

example.title: If site
example.programlisting: --Orc's conditional site: If -- publishes a signal if the argument is true If(1 > 0) >> "correct"
